intro: Uncaria gambier, commonly known as gambier vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, elliptic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. Its roots and stems are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant is also valued for its use in the production of ink and as a source of tannins.
